Break your study sessions into 25-minute chunks with 5-minute breaks (Pomodoro Technique).
Teach someone else what you’ve learned. It helps reinforce your memory.
Summarize each chapter in your own words — this boosts understanding.
Use diagrams, mind maps, or flashcards to visualize complex topics.
Start with the hardest subject first when your mind is fresh.
Stay consistent. Study a little every day rather than cramming.
Review old material regularly to keep it fresh in your memory.
Turn off notifications while studying to stay focused.
Drink water and take short walks — physical wellness improves mental clarity.
Set specific goals for each study session (e.g., 'Finish Chapter 2').
